Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but good place all round”
Reviews.Author: Matthew S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind a really tiny room (mine was 7 square metres) this is a good place to stay in Barcelona. I requested a balcony and if I hadn't had that, I couldn't have stayed there. My room had the smallest shower I've ever seen. I could get inside but couldn't turn right or left after that. The location is excellent because I can walk to most places I want to visit. The neighbourhood has plenty of bars, restaurants and shops. The cleaning staff is very active--I had to tell them not to bother every day as I didn't want to be disturbed. The rest of the staff is also very good and helpful. The breakfast (5.80) is probably a better deal than what's available in the neighbourhood. They probably have some rooms that are larger than mine but the receptionist said that basically all are small. If you're spending all day away from the hotel, maybe this isn't important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TareqHaji
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during MWC event in 2012. During this time, 64,000 exhibitions visitors came to Barcelona requiring accommodation which lead to the natural inflation of the hotel rates. This two-star hotel charged me Euro180 per night. I personally would not pay more than Euro50 if it wasn't a business trip. Pros: - I found the hotel location excellent, very close to a metro station (line L2 and L3). Only two stops from the Fira (Espanya metro station). - the room was clean and spacious (it was a twin bedroom). I was told by a colleague that in contrast the single bedroom is ridiculously small. - Walking distance to Ramblas (popular tourist spot) - Even though I had my window open, the street was relatively quiet and I slept well. - The shower had strong water pressure and hot water. Cons: - There was a TV screen which seemed no more than 21" LCD suspended from the ceiling. Only Spanish channels were available so I never watched any TV there. - The rooms had virtually no sound isolation, I can hear every word my neighbors were saying, sneeze, toilet flush, etc. - The toilet is clean, but the sink was tiny and you had to sit at angle when doing your business as the bathtub was in the way (see pic).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: xenagurl
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel centrally located to make getting around easy. About 20 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes from the port. A good hotel for pre and post cruise stays. Taxi is about 15 Euro to the Port which includes the entrance and exit fee. The Wifi Connection is good and the front desk staff very helpful and friendly. There is also free access to a nearby offsite gym however I didn't use it. Safe area about a 20 minute walk from Las Ramblas and near the stop for the HoHo buses. A tad noisy if your neighbors are up late and the elevator a bit slow. I'm not sure if the safes are functional (mine wasn't) but all in all nothing to complain about and I will be booking again for a future trip. There's a nice little Supermerkat?Supermarket across the street where you can pick up water bottles for your cruise if you choose.

Reviews.Title: “stay in hotel nuevo triunfo”
Reviews.Author: Omar E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: close to everything in barcelona........ nice people working there........... the rate was amazing............. will definitely stay there again next trip to barcelona...... ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, well-located hotel in expensive Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Fifi_banana
Reviews.Content: Found hotel by chance and was amazed at the price, as on past experience hotels seem expensive in Barcelona. Single room with bathroom was compact but adequate, and very clean. Friendly, helpful staff, free Wifi in room which worked well. Close to metro Paral.lel and only a few minutes walk from La Rambla and from the waterfront. Noisy plumbing as per other reviews, but noise reduced by closing bathroom door at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Super Clean, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: worldpacer
Reviews.Content: I check-in early and the room was ready, which is great when you get in BCN at 8am. The hotel & room were very clean and the staff was very friendly. They all seem to speak English although the tolerated my Spanish. Metro stop Paral-lel was short walk away and it is about a 10 minute walk to La Ramble and Barrio Gotico. I will gladly stay here again. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, great staff, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: 13Vivi13
Reviews.Content: I decided for this hotel due to the price and location. It's one block from the Metro Station Paralel, on the Avenue with the same name, where you can find several restaurants and cafes, and a neighborhood much less crowded than the very center. The hotel itself is small, however a great value for money. Stood for 2 nights, room and bathroom were clean, satellite tv, phone, WiFi. Reception staff was very friendly and gave me all the information I needed to find my way around. I did not had breakfast included, as at a walking distance I could find few different options. Great hotel, when back in Barcelona, I will consider for one more stay!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a rip off...”
Reviews.Author: DianeMLakeTahoe
Reviews.Content: We asked our cab driver not to take us to the Ramblas, we were taken directly there. We walk in, asked if this was the Ramblas they said no. It was really late and they said it would be 120 euros, translated with fees it came to $192. US dollars. The room was a small box, old bedspread, old cracked tub, plaster falling, ambulances going all night, and no aminities. We did have the best room which included a terrace with a view of clothes lines, poverty, and an old man across the way in his underwear watering his plants and feeding his dog... Not the most desireable place. We went to the beach area the next day and could have had a very nice room at 60 euros. WIFI was available at 5 euros, but didn't work, and I had to fight with the desk manager to get it back in the morning. I was so mad that he finally gave it back, to avoid the sceen I was going to make. He made the right move.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cheap Hotel in Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: lon1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed there while competing in Barcelona Marathon.. Hotel is easy to locate in nice quiet location yet 2 minutes walk to Metro and Bus stop and 15 mins walk to Ramblas , Marina etc... Staff were very friendly with excellent English.... Single room compact but all was in order; bed comfi , great shower etc....Lift in hotel is very slow and even though I was staying on the 5th floor it was quicker for me to walk up and down the stairs.... Only advice I'd give is Do Not under any circumstances pay for breakfast... Its basically non existant and cost me 8 euro per day as I booked hotel through travel company... There's a supermarket directly across the road and a couple of coffee shops nearby ... Overall I found it an excellent place to stay and was also very reasonably priced...

Reviews.Title: “Decently priced, good location”
Reviews.Author: Fluorescence
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in September 2010 in one of the single rooms on the 5th floor. Good points: - It is a 1 minute walk away from Parallel metro station from where you can catch a metro to the old city or can walk it in 10 mins! Also, easy bus access to the beach. easy access to the parc je olimpic via the funicular at Parallel station itself - The room although small was neat & clean. 24 hr hot water with a great shower & small bathtub Bad points: - The elevator is the slowest i ahve ever seen. It takes 5 minutes to come down 5 floors! - don't buy water from the machine in the hotel. it is very expensive. I paid 55 euros per night even though i booked a week before coming.

Reviews.Title: “YOU COULD A LOT WORST THAN THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: MrRobert1446
Reviews.Content: Quiete location with plenty restuarants in area.5mins from La Rambla and sea,3mins from metro>Hotel very quiete but cleaners start early(10AM circa).Small room but had all one needs and very clean.Would be better value if breakfast included in price even if continent.Wi fi extra 6 euros bit stingy,but I was content overall and if you want somewhere clean,cheap and location etc,I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hey, am I back in college?”
Reviews.Author: SuperLemon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Nuevo Triunfo for four nights in January. The room reminded me of a college dorm room, very spartan. The bed was rough on my neck and back, I had to stuff a couch cushion under my pillow. We reserved a "double" and it had a full size bed, and a full size futon. The room also had a desk, large window, tiny TV, closet space, and a bathroom. The bathroom smelled strongly enough of mildew that we kept the door closed at all times. The furniture in the bathroom was peeling and cracking. After our first shower we realized the back wall of the shower was not water tight and water flooded the bathroom, hallway, and part of our room. But once we aimed the shower head away from the back wall, it was fine. In fact the shower was fantastic: we always had hot water and it was some of the strongest water pressure I've felt! Now having said all of that....it was nice. It was quiet (although we were there in January), two blocks off of Avda Paral-el. The staff were very nice, helpful, polite...they suggested very close by restaurants. The hotel is within walking distance of La Rambla, and very close to a metro stop that'll get you anywhere. We loved Barcelona, and for the price this hotel was fine for us- you don't do a lot of sleeping in this town, and are you really going to watch TV while you're there?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gjp200
Reviews.Content: Good cheap and cheerful hotel , I had a single room which was fine , cleaned daily with Tv and air con / heating plus there was a terrace which was quite handy , 10 min walk into town , stay away from the bars restaurants and money exchanges on la rambla as you will get ripped off at every turn ! Jules verne bar charges 5euros for a beer ... terrible! Much better to go for the small tapas bars in the little side streets esp the one by the Apollo theatre (opposite side of the road at the beginging of the little street that leads to La Rambla) Main line train station at the very top of la rambla will take you on the coastal train if you fancy a day on the beach ie santa susannah , blanes, callela ... There are also nivce beaches in walking distance from the hotel too , just carry on round past the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel, worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: stone0046
Reviews.Content: Ok, I had looked at all the reviewes before i made the booking. Stayed for 3 nights. It is more or less what i expected, great location(about 10 mins´ walk from Las Ramblas if you take the short cut. But a friend of mine who lived in Barcelona for one year told me that the short cut could be a little doggy at night), small but clean room(cleaned everyday), very helpful staff. Plus there are loads of bars and restaurants and shops and an internet cafe around the hotel. However, i have to say there is a downside, the sound proof of the hotel is very poor.You can hear almost everything that is happening in your neighbours. On the first night, while i was watching TV (there are about 20 channels, but most of them are in spanish, only 2 english news channels), all of a sudden i felt a strange vibe noise, not too loud, but very clear. It took me about 5 mins to realised that it came from the next room, someone was snoring!! Well, apart from that, i don´t really have any other compains. So if you don´t want to break your bank just for a bed, yet you don´t want to share the room with others in a hostel, this hotel will just be fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Can a hotel be too clean??”
Reviews.Author: Johnny22
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nuevo Triunfo is a small and modern budget-hotel in Poble Sec, in the outskirts of the inner city of Barcelona. I had a single room for a few nights on the purpose of visiting a friend in the city. + It´s a modern place with refurbished rooms, great beds, nice bathrooms, friendly, helpful & english-speaking staff. The cleaning ladies are also worth mentioning - the do a good job. Very close to the metro station. The area is mostly residential with rather few tourists around. - The room is the smallest hotel room I have ever seen; perhaps 12 square meters, including bathroom. This may sound harsh, but the design of the room made it feel like a very modern prison cell. There is only one lamp with two options; you can flood the room with light, or keep it dark. The sound-proofing is quite bad. = Bring your earplugs and a reading lamp and you can have a great stay here. The basics at Nuevo Triunfo are good and makes it an interesting choice for us who wants to stay in a more budget-oriented place. It´s 100% practical and 0% romantic - better suited for the sole traveller then the honey-moon couple.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: timmytwoshoes
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 day stay at the Nuevo Trinfo, Clean room, sericved daily, staff very helpful, air con, TV. its basic, but for the price inn the centre of a city very good vaule. only draw back ,bit noisly at night. will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very cheap, but the room was very small either! The guy at the reception was very friendly and helpfull. We just spent an horrible night there ( there was a dog attached in the street and he was crying all the night! )

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M3Power
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying at this hotel. It's pretty average but could be considered good value as it's a reasonable price for the City of Barcelona. I did not consider it to be in a very nice area but it is close to the centre and public transport. I had a single room which was small! There is no bar either, there is a pub oposite but if you want hospitality or you can speak spanish/catalunya then don't go in there! If you are looking for a cheap hotel close to the centre then stay here. If you are looking for a quality hotel then I suggest you look elsewhere. Any questions drop me an email.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value for money. Good clean rooms, cleaned daily and in an excellent location. Exceeded expectations, will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: viki_o
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great! i wanted somwhere cheap and was looking at staying in a youth hostel but found this place for a bit more money than a hostel. the staff were very polite and helpful, the room was very clean with fresh sheets and towels daily! the best thing was i had a room with my own private balcony which was screened off and was a great little suntrap. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good value, good location, 10 minutes walk from La Rambla and 2 minutes walk to the nearest metro station. Very clean rooms, nice staff, and seems to be in a good area. I would recommend it as a place to stay in Barcelona for couples or groups, but not the best place to meet new people.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: SKIPMOW
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful reception for one of the least expensive hotels in Barcelona. Clean, new rooms and working air conditioning.
